introduction.p: Plot the following cash flows on one or more timelines. Indicate withdrawals with a minus sign.

task.p: A deposit is made of 500 at the end of year 1, and a deposit of 1250 is made at the end of year 4. The balance is withdrawn at the end of year 10. Calculate the amount withdrawn (using an interest rate of \iota = 2\%) and include that amount on your timeline.

A deposit is made of 500 at the g of year 1, and a deposit of 1250 is made at the g of year 4. The balance is withdrawn at the d of year 10. Calculate the amount withdrawn (using an interest rate of \iota = 2\%) and include that amount on your timeline..
A deposit of K is made into a pension fund at the end of every month for 30 years.
A withdrawal of K is made from a pension fund at the end of month 1. Each month thereafter, the amount of the withdrawal increases by 2.5%. This occurs every month for five years.

A deposit of 100 is made into an account at the end of year 1. Another deposit is made at the end of year 2, in the amount of 200. Another deposit, in the amount of 300, is made at the end of year 3. This continues for 10 years.

A deposit of 150 is made into an account at the end of year 1. Another deposit is made at the end of year 2, in the amount of 200. Another deposit, in the amount 150, is made at the end of year 3. This continues for 10 years.

A deposit of 1000 is made into an account at the end of year 1. The account earns an annual interest rate of 5%. At the end of each year until year n, the interest is withdrawn and deposited into a secondary account.

A deposit of 1000 is made into an account at the end of every year for 5 years. The account earns an annual interest rate of 5%. At the end of each year, the interest is withdrawn and deposited into a secondary account.
